en: This ticket is valid for three days.
zh: 这张票有效期是三天。

en: Oil has played an important part in the progress of Japanese industry.

en: His speech made a deep impression on the students.

en: The students are looking forward to the summer vacation.
zh: 学生们都在盼着放暑假。

en: All the students began talking at once.
zh: 所有的学生一下子都开始说话了。

en: All the students like holidays.

en: All students like holidays.
zh: 学生都喜欢放假。

en: The pupils learned many poems by heart.

en: The teacher is looked up to by the pupils.

en: Many of the students were tired.

en: Not only the students but also their teacher wishes for holidays.

zh: 不仅是那个学生，他们的老师也在盼着假期。

en: Will you make me up a dress if I give you the material?
zh: 如果我给你布料，你能帮我做件裙子吗？

en: The instinct for survival is inherent in every living thing.
zh: 生存本能是所有生物天生就有的。

en: They searched here and there looking for survivors.

en: The number of the living was smaller than that of the dead.
zh: 活人比死人少。

en: Productivity has fallen. Accordingly, workers' bonuses will be reduced.
zh: 生产率下降了，所以员工的奖金也跟着减了。

en: We'll employ a new tool to increase productivity.
zh: 我们要用个新工具来提高生产率。

en: Production improves by becoming more automatic.

en: The output is way below last year's level.

en: Production has remarkably increased.

en: Production is turning down.

en: My six-month old son is teething.

en: The cost of living has shot through the ceiling in the last year.
zh: 过去这一年，生活成本涨疯了。

en: The two felt the pressing necessity of earning a livelihood.
zh: 他们两个觉得必须得赶紧找生计了。

en: Work hard so that you may earn your living.
zh: 努力工作，好能养活你自己。

en: Don't quarrel with your bread and butter.
zh: 别跟自己的生计过不去。

en: When I came to, I found myself in the hospital.
zh: 我醒过来的时候，发现自己在医院。

en: It is very difficult to persuade people to change their life style.
zh: 想劝人们改变生活方式真的很难。

en: We cut our living costs.

en: Living is dear, accordingly we have to economize.
zh: 生活开销太大了，所以我们得省着点花。

en: Life is more and more expensive.
zh: 生活开支越来越高了。

en: The cost of living has greatly risen in the past ten years.
zh: 过去十年，生活成本涨了很多。

en: The cost of living is going up continuously.
zh: 生活成本一直在涨。

en: Living costs are getting higher.
zh: 生活费越来越贵了。

en: The cost of living has risen so quickly that it is almost impossible for us to make both ends meet.
zh: 生活费涨得太快了，我们快要入不敷出了。

en: It is getting more and more difficult to make a living.

en: Living standards should be higher.

en: As for the standard of living, the republic has caught up with the West.
zh: 论生活水平，这个共和国已经赶上西方了。

en: As for the standard of living, the republic has overtaken other developed countries.
zh: 在生活水平方面，这个共和国已经超过了其他发达国家。

en: No problem demands more urgency than the human conditions of life.

en: I have to tighten my belt.

en: Lifelong education means perpetual retraining.
zh: 终身教育意味着要不断地重新培训。

en: It was the biggest mistake of my life.
zh: 那是我这辈子犯的最大错误。

en: Every day in your life you're lonely.
zh: 你这辈子每天都很孤独。

en: He was doomed to life-long poverty.

en: The biochemistry test was a cinch.

en: He had the presumption to reject my proposal.
zh: 他竟然胆敢拒绝我的提议。

en: Nobody likes a wise guy.

en: I feel alive.

en: I want some fresh eggs.

en: As soon as man is born, he begins to die.
zh: 人一出生，就开始走向死亡。

zh: 毁掉一个人的往往不是错误本身，而是犯错后的态度。

en: I wish you'd never been born.
zh: 我真希望你压根儿就没出生。

en: He is by nature quite an easy-going man.
zh: 他天生就是个挺随和的人。

en: In natural gifts he is second to none.
zh: 论天赋，他谁也不输。

en: The baby was named Richard after his grandfather.
zh: 宝宝随他爷爷取名理查德。

en: A newborn baby is liable to fall ill.
zh: 新生儿很容易生病。

en: The new arrival was a lovely girl.
zh: 刚出生的宝宝是个可爱的小姑娘。

en: Have you ever eaten raw fish?

en: Raw fish is not to my taste.
zh: 我吃不惯生鱼片。

en: Raw fish easily goes bad.
zh: 生鱼很容易变质。

en: When it comes to raw fish, I feel disgusted.

en: Accrued interest will be paid into your account.
zh: 累计的利息会打进你的账户。

en: Flower arrangement is a part of Japanese culture.
zh: 插花是日本文化的一部分。

en: I'd like to learn how to arrange flowers.
zh: 我想学插花。

en: Flower arrangement is a traditional art in Japan.

en: Flower arranging is a traditional craft in Japan.
zh: 插花是日本的一种传统工艺。

en: All living things die some day.
zh: 所有的生物总有一天都会死。

en: Everything that lives will die sometime.

en: Food is always necessary for life.

en: To live is to suffer.

en: The instinct for survival is innate.

en: This is life!

en: I'll never forget your kindness as long as I live.

en: As long as we live, our heart never stops beating.

en: I want to live.

en: He has a reputation as being straight as an arrow. He'd never get involved in corruption.

en: Cleanliness is proper to the Japanese.

en: Cut a square in halves.

en: A square has four sides.

en: Honesty, I believe, is the best policy.

zh: 说实话，我不怎么喜欢古典音乐，但莫莉却非常迷它。

en: Frankly speaking, you are in the wrong.

en: Honesty is not always the best policy.

en: Honesty sometimes doesn't pay.

en: Honesty is a virtue.

en: I have often heard it said that honesty is the best policy.

en: I have to dress up.

en: At the New Year, we spend a lot of time with our family.
zh: 过年的时候，我们花很多时间陪家人。

en: New Year's Day is close at hand.
zh: 元旦快到了。

en: Justice will assert itself.

en: Let us be united in the cause of justice.

en: I fight in the cause of justice.

en: Justice and kindness are virtues.

en: When I came to myself, I was in the hospital.

en: When I came to, I found myself lying on the floor.
zh: 我醒过来的时候，发现自己躺在地上。

en: Are you losing your mind?

en: He came to himself.

en: Specifically, I'm a university lecturer.
zh: 具体点说，我是个大学讲师。

en: I'm actually a university teacher.
zh: 我其实是个大学老师。

en: To be accurate, he is to blame.
zh: 准确地说，这该怪他。

en: I do not know exactly.
zh: 我也不太清楚。

en: I'd like to know the exact time.

en: I forgot what the exact price was, but it was about 170 dollars.

en: I refer you to the dictionary for the correct spelling.

en: That's what I thought.

en: What's the right time?

en: Nothing is ever right.

en: It is sometimes hard to tell right from wrong.

zh: 尽管天气晴朗，空气还是挺冷的。

zh: 我觉得应该不会是晴天。

en: We can see Mt. Fuji far away on a fine day.
zh: 天气好的时候，远远就能看到富士山。

en: On a clear day, we can see Mt. Fuji in the distance.
zh: 天气晴朗时，可以看到远处的富士山。

en: The skies won't be clear.
zh: 天不会放晴的。

en: The weather won't be fine.
zh: 天气不会转好的。

en: It won't clear up.
zh: 天不会晴的。

en: It seems to be clearing up.
zh: 看起来天要晴了。

en: The weather clearing, he went out for a walk.
zh: 天一晴，他就出去散步了。

en: The weather cleared up, so he went out for a walk.
zh: 天晴了，所以他出去散步了。

en: The weather having cleared up, he went out for a walk.
zh: 天放晴后，他就出去散步了。

en: The weather clearing up, he went out for a walk.
zh: 趁着天晴，他出去散步了。

en: The weather is clearing up. I needn't have brought an umbrella.
zh: 天快晴了，我本不需要带伞的。

en: The skies are clear.
zh: 晴空万里。

en: The sky is clear.
zh: 天空很晴朗。

en: It's a clear day.
zh: 今天是晴天。

en: It's going to clear up.
zh: 天要放晴了。

en: It was sunny and warm.
zh: 那时天气晴朗，很暖和。

en: The stars were brilliant in the clear night sky.
zh: 晴朗的夜空里星光灿烂。

en: Nothing is so pleasant as taking a walk along the seaside on a fine day.
zh: 天气好的时候，没什么比在海边散步更舒服的了。

en: On a clear day, you can see Mt. Fuji.
zh: 天晴的时候能看到富士山。

en: Nothing is so pleasant as going on a picnic on a fine day.
zh: 天气好的时候，去野餐最开心了。

en: It was a fine day and there were no clouds in the sky.
zh: 那天是个大晴天，万里无云。

en: It was a fine day so I went on a picnic.
zh: 天气很好，所以我就去野餐了。

en: Nothing is more pleasant than to take a walk on a fine spring day.
zh: 没什么比在春天的大晴天里散步更惬意的了。

en: Look at the clear sky.
zh: 看这晴朗的天空。

en: It being fine, we started climbing Mt Fuji.
zh: 因为天气好，我们开始爬富士山了。

en: I think it will be sunny.
zh: 我觉得会是晴天。

en: Frequently clear and balmy weather deteriorates and it soon rains cats and dogs.
zh: 这种晴朗和暖的天气常常说变就变，很快就会下起倾盆大雨。

en: The sky is likely to clear up.
zh: 天可能会放晴。

en: It looks like it'll clear up.
zh: 看起来要晴了。

en: Mr Hoshino is hard to please.
zh: 星野先生这人挺难伺候的。

en: Mr. Hoshino is hard to please.
zh: 星野先生很难讨好。

en: According to the stars, she and I aren't supposed to have much chemistry between us.
zh: 根据星座运势，我和她之间没什么火花。

en: The asterisks mark important references.
zh: 星号标出了重要的参考内容。

en: Not a star was to be seen.
zh: 一颗星星也看不见。

en: It is interesting to look at the stars.
zh: 看星星挺有意思的。

en: Star-watching is good for your eyes.
zh: 看星星对眼睛有好处。

en: It is interesting to watch stars.
zh: 观察星星很有趣。

en: The stars look dim because of the city lights.
zh: 因为城市的灯光，星星看起来很暗淡。

en: The stars twinkled above her.
zh: 星星在她头顶闪烁。

en: Stars cannot be seen in the daytime.
zh: 白天看不见星星。

en: Stars shine above in the sky.
zh: 天上的星星闪闪发亮。

en: Let me wish upon a shooting star.
zh: 让我对着流星许个愿吧。

en: The stars came out.
zh: 星星出来了。

en: The stars were beginning to appear.
zh: 星星开始出现了。

en: The stars were twinkling in the sky.
zh: 天上的星星一闪一闪的。

en: The stars are shining in the sky.
zh: 星星在天上闪闪发光。

en: Stars began to appear in the sky.
zh: 天上开始出现星星了。

en: Stars are shining in the sky.
zh: 星星在天空中闪烁。

en: The stars are glittering above.
zh: 头顶的星星闪闪发光。

en: The stars are spread all over the night sky.
zh: 满天都是星星。

en: The stars twinkled.
zh: 星星闪了闪。

en: The stars are bright.
zh: 星星很亮。

en: Cleared, the site will be valuable.
zh: 这块地清理干净后就很值钱了。

en: A government official's stately mansion was looted.
zh: 一个政府官员的豪宅被抢了。

en: The authorities sent in troops to quell the riot.
zh: 当局派兵去平定暴乱了。

en: One of the government's proposals is to give out condoms in high schools.
zh: 政府的一个提议是在高中发放避孕套。

en: Down with the Government!
zh: 打倒政府！

en: Government officials inspected all factories.
zh: 政府官员检查了所有工厂。

en: Let's get some brochures from the travel bureau.
zh: 咱们去旅游局拿点宣传册吧。

en: It sounds as if the government doesn't know what to do.
zh: 听起来政府好像没辙了。

en: The government has the power of legislation.
zh: 政府拥有立法权。

en: The government will have to take drastic action to solve the problem.
zh: 政府必须采取强硬措施来解决这个问题。

en: The government acted boldly to deal with the outlaw uprising.
zh: 政府果断地处理了暴徒起义。

en: The government must enforce the law immediately.
zh: 政府必须立刻执法。

en: He argues that the administration must look for alternative sources of revenue.
zh: 他认为政府必须寻找别的收入来源。

en: The government lifted price controls.
zh: 政府取消了物价管制。

en: The government has held commodity prices in check.
zh: 政府控制住了物价。

en: The government promised to wipe out poverty.
zh: 政府承诺要消除贫困。

en: The government deprived him of all his rights.
zh: 政府剥夺了他所有的权利。

en: The government has increased its financial aid to the developing nations.
zh: 政府增加了对发展中国家的财政援助。

en: The government imposed a new tax on farmers.
zh: 政府对农民征收了一项新税。

en: The government should invest more money in agriculture.
zh: 政府应该给农业投入更多资金。

en: Although the government refuses to admit it, its economic policy is in ruins.
zh: 虽然政府不承认，但它的经济政策已经彻底搞砸了。

en: The government decided to impose a special tax on very high incomes.
zh: 政府决定对极高收入者征收特别税。

en: The government was overthrown.
zh: 政府被推翻了。

en: Governments usually resort to price control when inflation has reached a certain level.
zh: 当通货膨胀达到一定程度，政府通常会控制物价。

en: The government refuses to bow to public pressure.
zh: 政府拒绝向公众压力低头。

en: The administration cannot but look for alternative sources of revenue.
zh: 政府只好寻找其他的收入来源。

en: The government ordered that the price of soap be reduced by two pence.
zh: 政府下令肥皂降价两便士。

en: The government started tax reform.
zh: 政府开始了税制改革。

en: The government lightened taxes.
zh: 政府减了税。

en: The government made an announcement to the effect that taxes would be raised.
zh: 政府发布公告说要加税。

en: The government clamped down on the minority group.
zh: 政府镇压了那个少数群体。

en: The government made no move to solve the housing problem.
zh: 政府没有采取任何行动来解决住房问题。

en: The government is expelling illegal aliens as part of a crackdown.
zh: 作为打击行动的一部分，政府正在驱逐非法移民。

en: The government issued the following statement.
zh: 政府发表了如下声明。

en: The government is trying to bring things back to normal.
zh: 政府正努力让一切恢复正常。

en: The government has made efforts to make our country clean and green.
zh: 政府一直致力于让我们的国家变得更加洁净绿化。
